structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.catch_line: Practice under own name -- Titles that may be used.

text.section: Any person practicing or offering to practice podiatry shall practice under his own name only, as his name appears in his license.

No person practicing or offering to practice podiatry shall use any title or abbreviation thereof except the designation "podiatrist." The term "foot doctor" and "chiropodist," or either of them, may be used in conjunction with the title "podiatrist," but not as a substitute therefor and not alone.

law.history: Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 225, sec. 14. -- Amended 1962 Ky. Acts ch. 289, sec. 8. -- Created 1948 Ky. Acts ch. 176, sec. 9.
